messages.content: What is Video-LaVIT?
Video-LaVIT is a multi-modal large language model capable of both comprehending and generating videos, based on an efficient decomposed video representation.
What are the capabilities of Video-LaVIT?
Video-LaVIT has capabilities such as understanding image and video content, text-to-video generation, image-to-video generation, and long video generation.
How does Video-LaVIT represent videos during pre-training?

Video-LaVIT represents each video as keyframes and temporal motions, which are then adapted to an LLM using well-designed tokenizers that discretize visual and temporal information as tokens, enabling unified generative pre-training of videos, images, and text.
What datasets were used to train Video-LaVIT v1.0?
Video-LaVIT v1.0 was trained only on the open-sourced WebVid-10M dataset.
What is the purpose of the video detokenizer in Video-LaVIT?
The video detokenizer in Video-LaVIT carefully recovers the generated tokens from the LLM to the original continuous pixel space to create various video content.
How can users generate videos without watermarks using Video-LaVIT?
To generate videos without watermarks, users can manually intervene the keyframe tokens by a text-to-image model like Playground-v2.
What are the future plans for improving Video-LaVIT?

Future plans for improving Video-LaVIT include using more video training data without watermarks, improving long video generation performance, providing the sft finetuning code, and providing the evaluation code.
What is the purpose of the LaVIT Acceptable Use Policy?
The LaVIT Acceptable Use Policy outlines the prohibited uses of LaVIT to ensure that everyone uses it safely and responsibly.
What are some examples of illegal or unlawful activities prohibited by the LaVIT Acceptable Use Policy?

The policy prohibits using LaVIT to engage in, promote, generate, contribute to, encourage, plan, incite, or further activities such as violence, terrorism, exploitation or harm to children, human trafficking, exploitation, sexual violence, and other criminal activities.
Does the LaVIT Acceptable Use Policy prohibit the use of LaVIT for military or warfare applications?
Yes, the policy prohibits the use of LaVIT related to military, warfare, nuclear industries or applications, espionage, and use for materials or activities subject to ITAR.
Is it acceptable to use LaVIT to generate content intended to incite or promote violence according to the Acceptable Use Policy?
No, the policy strictly prohibits using LaVIT to generate any content intended to incite or promote violence, abuse, or any infliction of bodily harm to an individual.
Can LaVIT be used to create fake reviews or false online engagement?
No, the LaVIT Acceptable Use Policy prohibits generating or facilitating false online engagement, including fake reviews and other means of fake online engagement.
Is it acceptable to use LaVIT to generate or infer sensitive personal or private information without the required rights and consents?

No, the policy prohibits using LaVIT to collect, process, disclose, generate, or infer health, demographic, or other sensitive personal or private information about individuals without the rights and consents required by applicable laws.
Does the LaVIT Acceptable Use Policy require disclosing known dangers of an AI system to end users?
Yes, according to the policy, failing to appropriately disclose to end users any known dangers of your AI system is prohibited.
